country.name: Norfolk Island
country.background: Two British attempts at establishing the island as a penal colony (1788-1814 and 1825-55) were ultimately abandoned. In 1856, the island was resettled by Pitcairn Islanders, descendants of the Bounty mutineers and their Tahitian companions.

geo.note: most of the 32 km coastline consists of almost inaccessible cliffs, but the land slopes down to the sea in one small southern area on Sydney Bay, where the capital of Kingston is situated

location.desc: Oceania, island in the South Pacific Ocean, east of Australia

area.comparison: about 0.2 times the size of Washington, DC

geo.climate: subtropical; mild, little seasonal temperature variation
geo.terrain: volcanic formation with mostly rolling plains

people.ethnic-groups: descendants of the Bounty mutineers, Australian, New Zealander, Polynesian
people.religions: Anglican 31.8%, Roman Catholic 11.5%, Uniting Church in Australia 10.6%, Seventh-Day Adventist 3.2%, other Christian 5.6%, none 19.9%, unspecified 16.6% (2006 census)
people.languages: English (official), Norfolk (a mixture of 18th century English and ancient Tahitian)

government.dependency: self-governing territory of Australia; administered from Canberra by the Department of Regional Australia, Regional Development and Local Government

capital.name: Kingston
capital.time-difference: UTC+11.5 (16.5 hours ahead of Washington, DC during Standard Time)

government.national-holiday: Bounty Day (commemorates the arrival of Pitcairn Islanders), 8 June (1856)
government.legal-system: English common law and the laws of Australia

executive.head-of-state: Queen ELIZABETH II (since 6 February 1952); represented by the Australian governor general
executive.cabinet: Executive Council made up of 4 of the 9 members of the Legislative Assembly; the council devises government policy and acts as an advisor to the administrator
executive.elections: the monarchy is hereditary; governor general appointed by the monarch; administrator appointed by the governor general of Australia and represents the monarch and Australia

legislative.description: unicameral Legislative Assembly (9 seats; members elected by electors who have nine equal votes each but only four votes can be given to any one candidate; members to serve three-year terms)
legislative.elections: last held on 17 March 2010 (next to be held in 2013)

government.judicial: Supreme Court; Court of Petty Sessions

economy.overview: Tourism, the primary economic activity, has steadily increased over the years and has brought a level of prosperity unusual among inhabitants of the Pacific islands. The agricultural sector has become self sufficient in the production of beef, poultry, and eggs.
economy.agriculture-products: Norfolk Island pine seed, Kentia palm seed, cereals, vegetables, fruit; cattle, poultry
economy.industries: tourism, light industry, ready mixed concrete

exports.commodities: postage stamps, seeds of the Norfolk Island pine and Kentia palm, small quantities of avocados

telephones.international: country code - 672; undersea coaxial cable links with Australia and New Zealand; satellite earth station - 1
telephones.land-lines: 2,532; note - a mix of analog (2,500) and digital (32) circuits (2004)

communications.broadcast: 1 local radio station; broadcasts of several Australian radio and television stations are received via satellite (2009)

manpower.notes: defense is the responsibility of Australia
